subject: p15114531
History: Cough and increased sputum production following stent removal. PA and lateral upright chest radiographs were reviewed in comparison to. Heart size is normal. Mediastinum is normal. There is interval placement of Bravo pH capsule projecting over the expected location in the distal esophagus. Surgical clips in the left upper abdomen are unchanged. Lungs are clear and there is no pleural effusion or pneumothorax. Overall, there is minimal interval change including left lower lobe linear opacity that might represent atelectasis, although small infectious process in this area cannot be excluded. Note is also made of a large trachea, approaching 25 cm in coronal and 2 cm in the sagittal diameter in this patient with known tracheomalacia.
Impression: New left lower lobe linear opacity that might reflect developing/resolving infectious involving infectious process versus atelectasis. Tracheomegaly.
